title: Richard Thompson - Morris On (1972)
description:
Band: Morris On.

Album: Morris On.


If you are a fan of Fairport Convention, Richard Thompson, Steeleye Span, etc., you will want this record. It is a little uneven but there are some great tracks here. It's kind of a Folk-concept/folk supergroup album, based on the English Morris Dancing tradition (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_dance), featuring Richard Thompson, Ashley Hutchings, Dave Mattacks, John Kirkpatrick, and several other luminaries of the 60s folk revival era. You can hear an actual Morris "side" (troupe), the Chingford Morris Men, with their stick-dancing, on some tracks.

You won't play this every day, but if you like the English folk revival bands of the late 60s/early 70s, this record should be part of your collection. Highlights include the salacious "Cuckoo's Nest", "The Nutting Girl", "I'll go and 'list for a Sailor", and "Morris On"/"Morris Off", the opening and closing tracks.

There have been several descendants of this record ("Son of Morris On" etc.), but this is the original and still the best.
